title: Systems Neuroscience
description: This course explores how animal behaviors emerge from neuronal networks and systems, with a specific focus on principles of network operation and computational applications.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: (NEUR 2001 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or NEUR 2000 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or NEUR 2010 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C) or BMED 3100 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and MATH 1552 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and (MATH 1553 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1554 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1564 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)
